result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandi Star Geoffrey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED
Court notes no days credit.
If revoked Huber granted.

Defendant to report to Probation today November 5, 2015.
Court authorizes transfer of Probation to Minnesota.

 In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF106.

$17.20 Witness fee to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF106.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Mills Fleet Farm.
-Defendant to participate in Restorative Justice Program and Victim Empathy Panel.
-Defendant to testify truthfully in the cases of Michael Lewandowski (15CF109) and Cindy Geoffrey (15CF27).
-Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandi Star Geoffrey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, HPD, Jail & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF: Brandi Star Geoffrey appeared. Case called at 11:09. ADA Hartung updates the court there is an agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended charge misdemeanor attempted theft. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended charge of attempted theft. Sentencing arguments. Crt; Impose 4 mo St. Croix County Jail STAYED
 Court notes no days credit
 If revoked Court authorizes huber.
1 year probation with conditions:
- DE have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- DE to participate in Restorative Justice and victim empathy panel
- DE to testify truthfully in the cases of Michael Lewandowski(15CF109) and Cindy Geoffrey(15CF27).
- Costs and costs of supervision.

DE to report to probation today. Court authorizes transfer of probation to MN.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle DF:  Brandi Star Geoffrey appeared. Case called at 3:18. Atty. O'Boyle updates the court and requests a plea date. DE has other charges in Portage County. ADA Hartung agrees. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle,  DF:  Brandi Star Geoffrey appeared. Court reviews status of case. Discovery is discussed. Court orders supplementory discovery to be provided in the next 20 days. Court extends 10 business days to file motions. Address is confirmed and bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif

CO: Heckmann, Reporter: Tape, Clerk: Benoy 10:52    ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Brandi Star Geoffrey appeared.   INCLUDES 15CF106 & 15CF109.   Court notes phone request for Mr Lewandowski filed by Atty Harrelson for 15CF109.    Statements by Atty Hartung.  Atty Harrelson requests a continuance for 15CF109.  Atty O'Boyle wishes to proceed with 15CF106 today.   Court grants continuance for 15CF109 and requests that Atty Harrelson remain in the courtroom.   

15CF106:   S/T  A Kellermann.  Atty Hartung direct.  Atty O'Boyle cross. Witness excused.  S/T  Sargent J Willems.  Atty Hartung direct. Witness excused.  Atty O'Boyle cross.   Arguments by Attys.  Information provided to the Court.  Court finds probable cause and binds DF over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm in Hudson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
